Dear Parent_E, thank you for your message and for your continued interest.

We do not have a formal waitlist that guarantees an offer; however, we do keep note of families who have expressed sustained interest. If the seat remains available later in the process and no higher-priority application materializes, we would then be able to reconsider your application.

If you would like, you may check back in a few rounds to see whether our position has changed.

Nursery_C

Dear Parent_E,

In particular, some families who rank Nursery_C as a strong second/third option may only contact us after they learn they cannot secure their first choice.

Because of that, we are not setting a firm “offer-by” round today; however, our practical approach is:
- If we receive an [APPLY] from a higher-priority family while our seat is still open, we would need to consider them ahead of later-priority applicants.
- If we reach later rounds and no higher-priority application materializes, we will begin making an offer to the most suitable family among those who have shown sustained interest.

For now, the most helpful next step is for you to keep us updated on your timeline (e.g., if you will need to commit elsewhere by a certain round/date). If you share any deadline you face, we can be transparent about whether we can realistically decide before then.

True priority list ranks Parent_E last, but no other parents have applied to Nursery_C in many rounds; Parent_C previously applied and was rejected, and Parent_A/Parent_B have never applied despite Nursery_C being their 3rd/2nd choice respectively. At round 15, with no higher-priority applications in hand, the optimal action to secure a match is to accept Parent_E now.
